intro: Sarcophyllum, commonly known as the New Zealand tea tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to New Zealand and consists of several species, including Sarcophyllum lyallii and Sarcophyllum tetrandrum. These plants are shrubs or small trees, characterized by their aromatic leaves and small, white or pink flowers. They thrive in coastal and forested areas, often growing in well-drained soils. The leaves are used in traditional Māori medicine and are also valued for their essential oils.
